All Packages  Class Hierarchy  This Package  Previous  Next  Index

Class ec.plubar.UnumDefinition 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.plubar.UnumDefinition
public class UnumDefinition
extends Object
The description of a particular variety of unum. Assumes a host/client presence model and a fixed set of ingredient roles, but omits the actual choice of implementations for the ingredients themselves.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Chip Morningstar, Karl Schumaker

myClientPresenceMessages
An IntTable of client Presence message names keyed by Ingredient index (from myIngredientRoles).
myCreationMode
A flag indicating if this definition is finished or not.
myHostPresenceMessages
An IntTable of host Presence message names keyed by Ingredient index (from myIngredientRoles).
myIngredientRoles
A Hashtable of UnumIngredientEntries keyed by role name.
myName
A String used for labeling purposes as we can no longer distinguish between ua by Class type.
myUnumMessages
An IntTable of Unum message names keyed by Ingredient index (from myIngredientRoles).
NOREPLACE
Boolean used for determining replacement/non-replacement of message routing entries in the various tables
REPLACE
Boolean used for determining replacement/non-replacement of message routing entries in the various tables

Construct a new unum definition.

Add a new message to one of the several message arrays

Declare an interface in all presence interfaces.

Declare an interface in the unum presence interface.

createUnum()
Create a new unum that matches this definition.
decode(RtDecoder)
Decode this definition by encoding myIngredientRoles, myUnumMessages, myHostPresenceMessages, myClientPresenceMessages and myCreationMode.
encode(RtEncoder)
Encode this definition by encoding myIngredientRoles, myUnumMessages, myHostPresenceMessages, myClientPresenceMessages and myCreationMode.
ensureOpenDefinition()
Throw an exception if we are not in creation mode
findIngredient(String)
Package-use method to determine the integer index of a particular ingredient, indentified by role name.
finishDefinition()
Terminate creation mode.
getIngredientRoles()
Return the ingredient roles for this definition.
ingredientCount()
Return the number of ingredient roles for this definition.
ingrsToString()
A possibly bogus method for outputing myIngredientRoles; called only from toString().
presenceSend(boolean, Ingredient[], String, Object[])
Deliver a message to an ingredient via one of the presence interfaces.
tableToString(String, IntTable)
A possibly bogus method for outputing IntTables; called only from toString().
toString()
A possibly bogus method for outputing an UnumDefinition as a String; calls ingrsToString() and tehn tableToString() for myUnumMessages, myHostPresenceMessages and myClientPresenceMessages.
unumSend(Ingredient[], String, Object[])
Deliver a message to an ingredient via the unum interface.

myIngredientRoles 
 private Hashtable myIngredientRoles
A Hashtable of UnumIngredientEntries keyed by role name.

See Also:
IntTable
myUnumMessages 
 private IntTable myUnumMessages
An IntTable of Unum message names keyed by Ingredient index (from myIngredientRoles).

myHostPresenceMessages 
 private IntTable myHostPresenceMessages
An IntTable of host Presence message names keyed by Ingredient index (from myIngredientRoles).

myClientPresenceMessages 
 private IntTable myClientPresenceMessages
An IntTable of client Presence message names keyed by Ingredient index (from myIngredientRoles).

myCreationMode 
 private boolean myCreationMode
A flag indicating if this definition is finished or not.

myName 
 private String myName
A String used for labeling purposes as we can no longer distinguish between ua by Class type.

REPLACE 
 private static final boolean REPLACE
Boolean used for determining replacement/non-replacement of message routing entries in the various tables

NOREPLACE 
 private static final boolean NOREPLACE
Boolean used for determining replacement/non-replacement of message routing entries in the various tables

UnumDefinition 
 public UnumDefinition(String unumName)
Construct a new unum definition. The result will still be in creation mode.

Parameters:
unumName - The name for this definition; a placeholder at the moment (3/4/98), but something to have as a handle or label to una, as there is no way to distinguish them by Class any more...

createUnum 
 public Unum createUnum()
Create a new unum that matches this definition. The newly created unum will itself be returned in create mode and will not have any ingredients associated with it.

Returns:
A new Unum constructed with this UnumDefinition.
finishDefinition 
 public void finishDefinition() throws UnumException
Terminate creation mode. Called by the unum definition creator to indicate that it has added all the ingredient roles and messages.

Throws: UnumException
Thrown when there is an error in the definition
findIngredient 
 int findIngredient(String ingredient) throws UnumException
Package-use method to determine the integer index of a particular ingredient, indentified by role name.

Parameters:
ingredient - The role name of the ingredient desired
Returns:
The index of said ingredient in the ingredient roles array
Throws: UnumException
if 'ingredient' is null]
Throws: UnumException
if ingredient is not in myIngredientRoles[]
presenceSend 
 void presenceSend(boolean isHost,
                   Ingredient ingredients[],
                   String message,
                   Object args[]) throws UnumException
Deliver a message to an ingredient via one of the presence interfaces. Callable only from within the package. The only caller should be the 'send' method of the Presence class.

Parameters:
isHost - true=>deliver a host message, false=>a client message
ingredients - An array of the actual ingredients
message - Message to deliver
args - Message arguments
Throws: UnumException
if message is not in myHostPresenceMessages or myClientPresenceMessages
See Also:
send
unumSend 
 void unumSend(Ingredient ingredients[],
               String message,
               Object args[]) throws UnumException
Deliver a message to an ingredient via the unum interface. Callable only from within the package. The only caller should be the 'send' method of the Unum class

Parameters:
ingredients - An array of the actual ingredients
message - Message to deliver
args - Message arguments
Throws: UnumException
if message is not in myUnumMessages
See Also:
send

addInterface 
 private void addInterface(String interfaceName,
                           String ingredient,
                           IntTable messagesTable,
                           boolean replace) throws UnumException
Add a new interface to one of the several message arrays by adding each message individually.

Parameters:
interfaceName - The name of the interface to add
ingredient - The role name of the ingredient to deliver it to
messagesTable - The message IntTable to add the message to
replace - Boolean to determine whether or not to replace a message in the table if it is already routed
Throws: UnumException
if interfaceName does not exist)
Throws: UnumException
from addInterface(Class, String, IntTable, boolean)
See Also:
addInterface
addInterface 
 public void addInterface(Class intf,
                          String ingredient,
                          IntTable messagesTable,
                          boolean replace) throws UnumException
Add a new interface to one of the several message arrays. First, the super class of intf, if any, is added as an interface, then any interfaces which intf implements are added, and finally all public methods on intf itself are added. Note that interfaces or classes may be passed into this procedure.

Parameters:
intf - The Class of the interface to add
ingredient - The role name of the ingredient to deliver it to
messagesTable - The message IntTable to add the message to
replace - Boolean to determine whether or not to replace a message in the table if it is already routed
Throws: UnumException
from ensureOpenDefinition()
Throws: UnumException
from addMessage()
ensureOpenDefinition 
 private void ensureOpenDefinition() throws UnumException
Throw an exception if we are not in creation mode

Throws: UnumException
if myCreationMode is not true
ingredientCount 
 int ingredientCount()
Return the number of ingredient roles for this definition. This is used in Unum.java's constructor to initialize the size of its own ingredient array without the user having to indicated in 2 places the number of ingredients in an unum.

Returns:
the size of Hashtable myIngredientRoles.
See Also:
Unum
getIngredientRoles 
 Hashtable getIngredientRoles()
Return the ingredient roles for this definition. This is used, for example, by Unum.java's init() routine, which needs to get each of the ingredient states by role name from its soulState and then init() each item in its own table of actual ingredients.

Returns:
The Hashtable myIngredientRoles.
See Also:
init
encode 
 public void encode(RtEncoder encoder) throws UnumException
Encode this definition by encoding myIngredientRoles, myUnumMessages, myHostPresenceMessages, myClientPresenceMessages and myCreationMode.

Parameters:
encoder - The encoder to encode into
Throws: UnumException
when an IOException encoding error occurs in encoder.encodeObject() or encoder.writeBoolean().
See Also:
encodeObject, writeBoolean
decode 
 public void decode(RtDecoder decoder) throws UnumException
Decode this definition by encoding myIngredientRoles, myUnumMessages, myHostPresenceMessages, myClientPresenceMessages and myCreationMode.

Parameters:
decoder - The decoder to decode from
Throws: UnumException
when an IOException decoding error occurs in decoder.decodeObject() or decoder.readBoolean().
See Also:
decodeObject, readBoolean
ingrsToString 
 String ingrsToString()
A possibly bogus method for outputing myIngredientRoles; called only from toString().

Returns:
A list of the Ingredients' indices, names and encode status.
See Also:
toString
tableToString 
 String tableToString(String title,
                      IntTable table)
A possibly bogus method for outputing IntTables; called only from toString().

Returns:
A passed in 'title', the size of the IntTable and a list of index/message name pairs.
See Also:
toString
toString 
 public String toString()
A possibly bogus method for outputing an UnumDefinition as a String; calls ingrsToString() and tehn tableToString() for myUnumMessages, myHostPresenceMessages and myClientPresenceMessages.

Returns:
This UnumDefinition expressed as a String, listing Ingredients and message routing information along with myCreationMode's value.
Overrides:
toString in class Object
See Also:
ingrsToString, tableToString
